line_1: In t'other, at his Hours of Leisure,
line_2: He smokes his Pipe, and takes his Pleasure.

line_1: A soul benign, whose cheerful leisure
Who can, when her Family Cares give her Leisure,
line_2: Without the dear Cards, pass an Ev'ning with Pleasure;

line_1: And a good natur'd muse to retire to at leisure,
line_2: Who will wrap me in rhimes, and inspire me with measure.

line_1: "I found in reading, or in leisure!
Because I scrawl but at my leisure;
line_2: 'Tis true I write in shorten'd measure,

line_1: Her Book and her Pen had her Moments of Leisure.
line_2: She liv'd in much Peace, but ne'er courted Pleasure;

line_1: But ere they've had a moment's leisure,
line_2: Be sure to interrupt their pleasure;
